triples.name: Backstepping
triples.relevance: Backstepping is the foundational control design technique that the paper builds upon to develop its predefined-time control lemma.

triples.name: Neural network (machine learning)
triples.relevance: Neural networks are used as a key component for approximating nonlinear functions in the adaptive control approach.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel adaptive neural control method that enables controllers to adapt to unknown system parameters.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of nonlinear multiagent systems using nonlinear control theory techniques.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multiagent systems are the problem domain for which the predefined-time tracking control approach is designed.

triples.name: Stability theory
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel predefined-time stability concept that guarantees convergence within a user-specified finite time.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov theory forms the mathematical foundation for proving the stability properties of the proposed control scheme.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory provides the theoretical framework for designing feedback controllers for the multiagent systems.
